<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/14/coronavirus-crisis-worse-2008-parallels-great-depression-imf-says?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
IMF: It's Bad
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Globe deflated" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81OTEvZ2xvYmVfZGVmbGF0ZWQuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A priest, a rabbit, and a monk walk into a bar. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The rabbit says, "I think I'm a typo." </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wanted to give you a bit of dad-joke joy before diving into our top story. Which is this: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) <a href="https://blogs.imf.org/2020/04/14/the-great-lockdown-worst-economic-downturn-since-the-great-depression/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">crunched the numbers</a> and concluded we're in the worst economic catastrophe since the Great Depression. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Introducing...the "Great Lockdown": </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Global output per person </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/d5f05b5c-7db8-11ea-8fdb-7ec06edeef84?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will contract</a></span><span> 4.2% this year, the IMF predicts. It shrank less than half that much during the 2008–09 financial crisis. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The IMF's baseline scenario for global economic growth this year: -3%. In the worst-case scenario—lockdowns extending into the second half of the year and a second wave of infections next year—GDP could fall by another 8% in 2021.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Cumulative GDP loss over 2020 and 2021: about $9 trillion, more than the economies of Japan and Germany combined. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Not great, Bob</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's not just the size that draws comparisons to 1929, it's this crisis's reach. Namely, all over the world. "For the first time since the Great Depression both advanced economies and emerging market and developing economies are in recession," the IMF writes. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The IMF projects diminishing income per capita in more than 170 countries.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One notable exception: </strong>Guyana, a small country perched on the northern coast of South America. Its economy is <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-14/world-economy-may-be-crashing-but-guyana-still-seen-growing-53?srnd=premium&sref=1crrKBaO&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">forecast to grow 53%</a> in 2020, easily the most of any country and the only economy in the Americas expected to grow at all this year. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Guyana can thank offshore oil fields that may hold 8 billion barrels of black gold, which have attracted meaty investments from energy majors. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the IMF anticipates a partial global recovery in 2021. But that, too, will be shaped by the length of lockdowns and whether there's a second wave of infections. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/14/treasury-airlines-reach-agreement-pandemic-relief-funds?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Airlines Find Emergency Exit
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, prominent U.S. air carriers came to a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-14/airlines-have-agreement-in-principle-on-u-s-coronavirus-aid?sref=1crrKBaO&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">preliminary agreement</a> with the Treasury Department over $25 billion in payroll assistance. That pile of cash was included in last month’s $2.2 trillion relief package. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Treasury said all major carriers would be covered. $5.8 billion is earmarked for American Airlines, while $3.2 billion is headed to Southwest Airlines, according to the companies. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The attached strings: Airlines must use the funds to </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/04/14/politics/airlines-payroll-aid/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">prevent layoffs</a></span><span>, and they've agreed to limitations on exec compensation and stock buybacks. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Airlines were hoping for support of the stringless variety, but they weren’t in much of a bargaining position.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That's because almost no one is flying—all but 5% of U.S. daily passenger demand has evaporated, forcing carriers to cut capacity as much as 80%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>the Treasury reportedly plans to start distributing the funds as early as this week.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PERSONAL FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/14/irs-begins-distributing-stimulus-checks?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Check Your Bank Account
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There may be a deposit from the government there. If not...you can make sure your roommate’s wi-fi payment went through. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Internal Revenue Service <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2020/04/14/1200-relief-checks-have-begun-arriving-bank-accounts-people-are-mostly-spending-it-food/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">started distributing</a> “stimulus checks” to American taxpayers over the weekend. Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin said 80 million people are expected to have received a direct deposit by today. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Most Americans are doing their personal finance profs proud. According to Netspend, the company that processed almost $1 billion in relief payments over the weekend, the infusion is being spent on food, gas, pharmacies, and withdrawing cash from ATMs. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quick refresher: </strong>As part of the federal government’s $2.2 trillion rescue package, most adults with an adjusted gross income under $99,000 were promised a one-time check to give consumer spending a jolt. In total, about 125 million Americans are expected to receive a payment.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Want more?</strong> Ramit Sethi explains how COVID-19 affects your personal finances on our latest podcast episode of <a href="https://www.businesscasual.fm/how-covid-19-impacts-your-personal-finance/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Business Casual</em></a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY THE MOTLEY FOOL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Your Lighthouse in the Investing Fog
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/all-in-advert?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=sar-allinalert&aid=9223&paid=9223&waid=9223&source=esamnbwdg0210063&psource=esamnbwdg0210063&wsource=esamnbwdg0210063" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="The Motley Fool" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMjAxLzE1ODUzMzE1MzMtRmluYW5jZS0xMDAuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0IjoiY29tZXQtbW9ybmluZ2JyZXciLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’re looking to invest in the stock market these days, you’d be well within your rights to feel overwhelmed, confused, and in need of some guidance.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Motley Fool </strong>can be your <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/all-in-advert?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=sar-allinalert&aid=9223&paid=9223&waid=9223&source=esamnbwdg0210063&psource=esamnbwdg0210063&wsource=esamnbwdg0210063" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lighthouse in the investing fog</a>. You know, like how ships in the old days didn’t have phones, and they needed to navigate by—right, you get it.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Motley Fool has been around since 1993, helping members navigate through the dot com bubble, the housing crisis, and now, market volatility due to COVID-19. They know about investing during crises, because they’ve weathered storms before.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Let the navigation begin:</strong> The past 25 times David and Tom have agreed on stocks, they’ve beat the S&P by more than 6x. And their 26th agreement just happened with this “<a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/all-in-advert?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=sar-allinalert&aid=9223&paid=9223&waid=9223&source=esamnbwdg0210063&psource=esamnbwdg0210063&wsource=esamnbwdg0210063" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">all in buy</a>” sign.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Members can also tune into <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/all-in-advert?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=sar-allinalert&aid=9223&paid=9223&waid=9223&source=esamnbwdg0210063&psource=esamnbwdg0210063&wsource=esamnbwdg0210063" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Fool’s daily live Q&As</a> with their CEO and analysts for further navigation advice.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ADVERTISING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/14/election-tokyo-olympics-2020-supposed-advertisers-dream?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Advertisers Are Sadder Than a Sarah McLachlan Commercial
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Between the election and the Tokyo Olympics, 2020 was supposed to be the year of the marketer. But as clients lock up budgets, the industry is slipping into a crisis no Peloton ad can match.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Publicis Groupe was the first of the big three ad holding companies to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/ad-giant-publicis-warns-of-unprecedented-spending-pullback-11586804429?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">report earnings</a>. CEO Arthur Sadoun expects an industrywide downturn much worse than 2009’s 10% hit. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Q1 organic revenue dropped 15% in China and 0.5% in North America, indicating “the U.S. is still only at the beginning,” Sadoun told the WSJ. However, China’s luxury and retail sectors are yawning back to life now that the country is reopening. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With top marketing spenders like travel, food, auto, and retail taking the biggest whack, Publicis’s peers will be singing the same tune. Omnicom Group CEO John Wren <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/14/advertising-companies-brace-for-downturn-as-coronavirus-rattles-ad-spending.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told employees</a> yesterday the company will furlough across some agencies. And last month, WPP withdrew its dividend.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>companies with ad budgets to spare will have to compete for the limited live events and launches remaining. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Speaking of...</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/14/nbcuniversals-peacock-joins-streaming-wars-amid-pandemic?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
NBC Crashes the Quarantine Watch Party
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="30 rock scene" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/588/30_rock_scene.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="30 rock scene" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/588/30_rock_scene.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The pandemic may have taken our bar crawls, sleepovers, and haircuts, but it can't take our remotes. NBCUniversal pushed ahead today with the soft launch of its streaming service, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/16/nbcuniversals-got-details-peacock?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Peacock</a>, to Comcast customers. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Earlier this week, NBCUniversal <a href="https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/nbcus-peacock-ads-launch-sponsors-debut-1289965?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> new launch sponsors including Verizon, Molson Coors, and L'Oréal, proving that despite the downturn in the advertising industry, brands still want prime spots on hot new platforms. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The coronavirus pandemic has pushed back movie launches and canceled <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/04/14/834098998/florida-designates-pro-wrestling-essential-business?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">almost all</a> live sports. That’s a void <em>Law & Order </em>can fill. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Quarantined consumers are <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-14/how-is-coronavirus-changing-the-way-people-use-media?sref=1crrKBaO&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">watching more</a> content throughout the day, with time spent streaming in the 11am–2pm range up over 40% in March, per Bloomberg. They're also spending more time with other forms of entertainment: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Gaming platform Twitch logged 1.3 billion hours streamed last month. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Quibi, the mobile-streaming platform launched last week, said viewers are watching its shortform videos consistently throughout the day.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But…after just one week of complaints, Quibi <a href="https://twitter.com/ballmatthew/status/1250103869796990984?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">backtracked</a> on its mobile-first shtick. Quibi says it will offer an option to watch on TV screens, possibly within the next six months. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/04/14/sf-doctor-chiefs-victory-super-bowl-likely-saved-lives?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Chiefs Fans Were on the Right Side of History
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The next time you’re frustrated about sports and someone says, “C’mon, it’s not a matter of life and death,” you can respond, “Actually…” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dr. Niraj Sehgal, who co-leads the University of California San Francisco’s COVID-19 command center, is out with this <a href="https://www.si.com/nfl/chiefs/news/chiefs-super-bowl-coronavirus-covid-19?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fascinating argument</a>: Had the 49ers topped the Kansas City Chiefs in February’s Super Bowl, the city would have held a big, crowded parade that unwittingly would have boosted the spread of the coronavirus. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>SF was one of the first cities in the U.S. to experience a coronavirus outbreak. In fact, the Super Bowl happened the </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-49ers-lost-the-super-bowl-and-may-have-saved-lives-11586858401?mod=hp_lead_pos12&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">same night</a></span><span> that Sehgal was setting up the command center. The UCSF hospital's first COVID-19 patients came the next morning. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Sporting events have proven to be super coronavirus-spreaders in other parts of the world. A Champions League soccer match held in Milan on Feb. 19 has been called “<a href="https://apnews.com/ae59cfc0641fc63afd09182bb832ebe2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Game Zero</a>” for unleashing COVID-19 on the Italian city of Bergamo.</p>

<p class="p-rich_text_section" style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This section is the equivalent of us "just circling back" to remind you that we are giving away MacBook Pros to readers. </p>

<p class="p-rich_text_section" style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">How to start: </strong>Click the share button below to grab your unique referral link. <h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We've been gathering some of the juiciest work-from-home stories from readers, and it's like a Georgia peach in July out there. Today, we're heading back to school for some delicious awkwardness:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"In the middle of a Zoom class, one girl thought she was on mute and answered her phone with "Sup, b****?" and the professor definitely thought she was speaking to her. She had to stay on the call and apologize."</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"During a Zoom class session for an MBA class, a classmate had his video on but seemed to believe he had stepped off-camera. He stuck his hand down the front of his gym shorts at which point our professor stopped mid-sentence and there was an extremely awkward 30 seconds of silence. I nearly fell out of my chair I was laughing so hard."</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/paI0M3?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Send us more stories here</a>.</p>

And a May 1 target date for many parts of the country is “a bit overly optimistic.” President Trump is pushing for earlier for some collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA priest, a rabbit, and a monk walk into a bar. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe rabbit says, \"I think I'm a typo.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWanted to give you a bit of dad-joke joy before diving into our top story. Which is this: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) \u003ca href=\"https://blogs.imf.org/2020/04/14/the-great-lockdown-worst-economic-downturn-since-the-great-depression/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecrunched the numbers\u003c/a\u003e and concluded we're in the worst economic catastrophe since the Great Depression. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIntroducing...the \"Great Lockdown\": \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eGlobal output per person \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/d5f05b5c-7db8-11ea-8fdb-7ec06edeef84?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill contract\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e 4.2% this year, the IMF predicts. It shrank less than half that much during the 2008–09 financial crisis. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe IMF's baseline scenario for global economic growth this year: -3%. In the worst-case scenario—lockdowns extending into the second half of the year and a second wave of infections next year—GDP could fall by another 8% in 2021.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCumulative GDP loss over 2020 and 2021: about $9 trillion, more than the economies of Japan and Germany combined. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNot great, Bob\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt's not just the size that draws comparisons to 1929, it's this crisis's reach. Namely, all over the world. \"For the first time since the Great Depression both advanced economies and emerging market and developing economies are in recession,\" the IMF writes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe IMF projects diminishing income per capita in more than 170 countries.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne notable exception: \u003c/strong\u003eGuyana, a small country perched on the northern coast of South America. Its economy is \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-14/world-economy-may-be-crashing-but-guyana-still-seen-growing-53?srnd=premium\u0026sref=1crrKBaO\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eforecast to grow 53%\u003c/a\u003e in 2020, easily the most of any country and the only economy in the Americas expected to grow at all this year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGuyana can thank offshore oil fields that may hold 8 billion barrels of black gold, which have attracted meaty investments from energy majors. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe IMF anticipates a partial global recovery in 2021. But that, too, will be shaped by the length of lockdowns and whether there's a second wave of infections. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, prominent U.S. air carriers came to a \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-14/airlines-have-agreement-in-principle-on-u-s-coronavirus-aid?sref=1crrKBaO\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epreliminary agreement\u003c/a\u003e with the Treasury Department over $25 billion in payroll assistance. That pile of cash was included in last month’s $2.2 trillion relief package. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Treasury said all major carriers would be covered. $5.8 billion is earmarked for American Airlines, while $3.2 billion is headed to Southwest Airlines, according to the companies. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe attached strings: Airlines must use the funds to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/04/14/politics/airlines-payroll-aid/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprevent layoffs\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, and they've agreed to limitations on exec compensation and stock buybacks. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAirlines were hoping for support of the stringless variety, but they weren’t in much of a bargaining position.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat's because almost no one is flying—all but 5% of U.S. daily passenger demand has evaporated, forcing carriers to cut capacity as much as 80%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethe Treasury reportedly plans to start distributing the funds style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nADVERTISING \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nAdvertisers Are Sadder Than a Sarah McLachlan Commercial\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBetween the election and the Tokyo Olympics, 2020 was supposed to be the year of the marketer. But as clients lock up budgets, the industry is slipping into a crisis no Peloton ad can match.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Publicis Groupe was the first of the big three ad holding companies to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/ad-giant-publicis-warns-of-unprecedented-spending-pullback-11586804429?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereport earnings\u003c/a\u003e. CEO Arthur Sadoun expects an industrywide downturn much worse than 2009’s 10% hit. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eQ1 organic revenue dropped 15% in China and 0.5% in North America, indicating “the U.S. is still only at the beginning,” Sadoun told the WSJ. However, China’s luxury and retail sectors are yawning back to life now that the country is reopening. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith top marketing spenders like travel, food, auto, and retail taking the biggest whack, Publicis’s peers will be singing the same tune. Omnicom Group CEO John Wren \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/04/14/advertising-companies-brace-for-downturn-as-coronavirus-rattles-ad-spending.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold employees\u003c/a\u003e yesterday the company will furlough across some agencies. And last month, WPP withdrew its dividend.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ecompanies with ad budgets to spare will have to compete for the limited live events and launches remaining. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe pandemic may have taken our bar crawls, sleepovers, and haircuts, but it can't take our remotes. NBCUniversal pushed ahead today with the soft launch of its streaming service, \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/01/16/nbcuniversals-got-details-peacock?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ePeacock\u003c/a\u003e, to Comcast customers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEarlier this week, NBCUniversal \u003ca href=\"https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/nbcus-peacock-ads-launch-sponsors-debut-1289965?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e new launch sponsors including Verizon, Molson Coors, and L'Oréal, proving that despite the downturn in the advertising industry, brands still want prime spots on hot new platforms. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe coronavirus pandemic has pushed back movie launches and canceled \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/coronavirus-live-updates/2020/04/14/834098998/florida-designates-pro-wrestling-essential-business?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ealmost all\u003c/a\u003e live sports. That’s a void \u003cem\u003eLaw \u0026 Order \u003c/em\u003ecan fill. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eQuarantined consumers are \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-14/how-is-coronavirus-changing-the-way-people-use-media?sref=1crrKBaO\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewatching more\u003c/a\u003e content throughout the day, with time spent streaming in the 11am–2pm range up over 40% in March, per Bloomberg. They're also spending more time with other forms of entertainment: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGaming platform Twitch logged 1.3 billion hours streamed last month. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eQuibi, the mobile-streaming platform launched last week, said viewers are watching its shortform videos consistently throughout the day.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut…after just one week of complaints, Quibi \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/ballmatthew/status/1250103869796990984?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebacktracked\u003c/a\u003e on its mobile-first shtick. Quibi says it will offer an option to watch on TV screens, possibly within the next six months. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" History\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe next time you’re frustrated about sports and someone says, “C’mon, it’s not a matter of life and death,” you can respond, “Actually…” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDr. Niraj Sehgal, who co-leads the University of California San Francisco’s COVID-19 command center, is out with this \u003ca href=\"https://www.si.com/nfl/chiefs/news/chiefs-super-bowl-coronavirus-covid-19?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efascinating argument\u003c/a\u003e: Had the 49ers topped the Kansas City Chiefs in February’s Super Bowl, the city would have held a big, crowded parade that unwittingly would have boosted the spread of the coronavirus. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli
